comments:
I was testing the RCP tutorial part 3 example 
(http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-ui-home/rcp-
proposal/rcp_tutorial/tutorial3.html) with M7 and the old-look jars and 
somehow got this crash. I'm not sure what I did because I can't make it happen 
again. This application does not have a progress indicator or a status bar so 
that might have something to do with it.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManager$JobMonitor.<init>
(ProgressManager.java:147)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManager.progressFor
(ProgressManager.java:430)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.progress.ProgressManager.createMonitor
(ProgressManager.java:402)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.createMonitor
(JobManager.java:246)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.JobManager.startJob
(JobManager.java:798)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.WorkerPool.startJob
(WorkerPool.java:204)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:55)

Ok, it just happened two more times. All I did was start the application and 
when it came up I pressed the shell close button. It doesn't happen every time 
so maybe it's some kind of timing issue.

Here's the launch config I'm using. I'm running it on 1.4.1.

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<launchConfiguration type="org.eclipse.pde.ui.RuntimeWorkbench">
<booleanAttribute key="clearws" value="true"/>
<booleanAttribute key="usefeatures" value="false"/>
<booleanAttribute key="tracing" value="false"/>
<stringAttribute key="vmargs" value=""/>
<booleanAttribute key="default" value="false"/>
<booleanAttribute key="clearConfig" value="true"/>
<booleanAttribute key="org.eclipse.debug.core.appendEnvironmentVariables" 
value="true"/>
<stringAttribute key="org.eclipse.jdt.launching.SOURCE_PATH_PROVIDER" 
value="org.eclipse.pde.ui.workbenchClasspathProvider"/>
<stringAttribute key="onePluginID" value="org.eclipsepowered.rcptutorial3"/>
<stringAttribute key="progargs" value="-os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -nl 
en_US -consoleLog"/>
<booleanAttribute key="useDefaultConfig" value="true"/>
<stringAttribute key="checked" value="[NONE]"/>
<booleanAttribute key="askclear" value="false"/>
<booleanAttribute key="onePlugin" value="true"/>
<stringAttribute key="application" 
value="org.eclipsepowered.rcptutorial3.RcpApplication"/>
<stringAttribute key="org.eclipse.debug.core.source_locator_id" 
value="org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.javaSourceLocator"/>
<stringAttribute key="location0" value="d:\runtime-workspace"/>
</launchConfiguration>

May be a result for Bug 48277 as we need to remove it from RCP applications. 
Was it the maximize button (the last one) you pressed?

No, I didn't press anybody's maximize button. If you're talking about the 
maximize button in the little progress popup window, I never saw that window.

I just started the application, waited a couple seconds, and pressed the big 
red X (Windows XP close button) on the top level application shell window.

Which virtual machine are you using? We suspect there may be a jit bug here. I 
am moving some thing around (more final and less work in the constructor) to 
prevent this problem in the future but we don't see how it could happen 
currently in the code.

java.version=1.4.1
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments: -data d:\workspace

I can upgrade if that's the problem.

There were a lot of JIT bugs with that one. We are using 1.4.2 or greater 
(currently version 03, November 2003) because of them.

I am going to close this - please reopen if it happens with a 1.4.2 VM.
